revised_title: Awards and Achievements in Science: Honoring Pioneers in Physics, Astrophysics, and Biology
tldr: The article highlights the accomplishments of several scientists, including S. Chapman, H. C. van de Hulst, M. J. Lighthill, F. W. Rogers Brambell, and M. Calvin. Chapman is recognized for his work in geophysics and magnetism, van de Hulst for his prediction of the 21 cm spectral line in radio astronomy, Lighthill for his contributions to aerodynamics and mathematics, Brambell for his research on protein transfer in mammals, and Calvin for his studies on photosynthesis and biosynthesis. These scientists' discoveries have had a significant impact on various fields of science.
